meanings.definition: A loud, electric horn or alarm typically used on emergency vehicles.
meanings.sent1: The klaxons blared loudly as the fire truck rushed to the scene.
meanings.sent2: The klaxons on the ambulance alerted everyone to move out of the way.
meanings.sent3: The klaxons seemed to be in a competition with the sirens to see who could be the loudest.
meanings.sent4: The klaxons wailed like a distressed elephant in the night.
meanings.sent5: The piercing sound of the klaxons echoed through the silent streets, waking up the entire neighborhood.

meanings.definition: A loud, harsh sound or noise.
meanings.sent1: The klaxons of the construction site could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent2: The klaxons of the factory filled the air with a cacophony of noise.
meanings.sent3: The klaxons of the school bell signaled the end of the day.
meanings.sent4: The klaxons of the thunderstorm made the windows rattle.
meanings.sent5: The klaxons of the angry geese disturbed the peaceful pond.
